thread.title: What Zlatan Ibrahimovic REALLY said to referee Kevin Friend during Manchester United v Bournemouth
thread.title_full: What Zlatan Ibrahimovic REALLY said to referee Kevin Friend during Manchester United v Bournemouth

author: Mark Jones
title: What Zlatan Ibrahimovic REALLY said to referee Kevin Friend during Manchester United v Bournemouth
text:
Sport What Zlatan Ibrahimovic REALLY said to referee Kevin Friend during Manchester United v Bournemouth The giant Swede stayed on the pitch despite the small matter of elbowing Tyrone Mings in the head during the feisty clash at Old Trafford, but just what was he saying? Share Best mates (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
When you're Zlatan Ibrahimovic , people want to be your friend. And especially people called Friend. 
Referee Kevin Friend was in a forgiving mood with the Swede on on Saturday afternoon, deciding not to sent him off despite his clear elbow to the face of Bournemouth's Tyrone Mings - who had just introduced his studs to the side of the big man's head. 
Both men should have gone, really, but what was most interesting about the whole affair was the sight of Zlatan chatting to Friend as the referee decided what his next move was going to be. It ended up being sending off Andrew Surman. Ow Say what you want about Zlatan, when he goes for it he really connects (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
But what did Zlatan say to Friend? 
Well, thanks to our completely made up access to their conversation, we know. "He faced my elbow, ref" (Photo: Matthew Peters) "I mean, what kind of name even is Mings anyway?" (Photo: REUTERS) "I'm warning you ref, if you send me off then you will be referenced in some sort of weirdly cryptic interview I'll give after the game" (Photo: REUTERS) "Gothenburg is lovely this time of year, yeah. Just say Zlatan sent you" (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) "Oh go on, pl ase??? Pretty please?" (Photo: Matthew Peters) Did referee Kevin Friend "bottle it" by NOT sending off Zlatan Ibrahimovic? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
